title: Manchester City 'showing interest' in Barcelona target Albert Sambi Lokonga
text:
Manchester City are weighing up the possibility of a swoop for Albert Sambi Lokonga but will face a battle for his signature from Spanish sides including Barcelona.

The Anderlecht starlet has impressed for the Belgian side this term playing as a holding midfielder and is valued at around £4.5million.

However, he is out of contract in the summer and that has piqued the interest of many top sides including City and Barcelona who are also keeping tabs on the 19-year-old according to Marca.

Albert Sambi Lokonga (left) of Anderlecht is being tracked by Pep Guardiola's Manchester City

City could open talks with Lokonga in January over arranging a free transfer next summer.

Sevilla have also entered the race to sign the Belgium Under-21 international.

But despite his contract running down, Lokonga has not ruled out staying at the Belgian side. Lokonga said: 'My priority is to stay at Anderlecht for two more years.'

The Belgian's form has been a bright point in what has otherwise been a miserable campaign so far for Anderlecht.

Under the management of former City captain and defender Vincent Kompany they reside 13th in the 16-team Belgian top flight.
description: Manchester City are weighing up the possibility of a swoop for Albert Sambi Lokonga but will face a battle for his signature from Spanish sides including Barcelona and Sevilla.
